words.defineEn: to allow or show the possibility of something
words.defineVi: để cho phép hoặc hiển thị khả năng của một cái gì đó

examples: But she was this harbinger of revolution, which is a priori in the Russian mind a bad thing, and for the Ukrainians she was a supporter, an advocate for revolution, which they also saw as a good thing.
words.defineEn: using the previous knowledge, reasoning, or general facts to decide the likely result of something
words.defineVi: sử dụng kiến thức, lý luận hoặc sự kiện chung trước đó để quyết định kết quả có thể xảy ra của một điều gì đó

words.defineEn: very probably; most possibly
words.defineVi: rất có thể; rất có thể

words.word: to [be] in with a chance of {sth}
words.phonetic: təbi ɪn wɪð ɐ tʃæns ʌv ɛstiːeɪtʃ
words.defineEn: to be likely for someone to succeed in doing something
words.defineVi: để có khả năng cho một người nào đó để thành công trong việc làm một cái gì đó

examples: Two could play at that game, smart guy.
Doctors couldn't stop the bleeding.
That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
The guy couldn't even harm a flea.
I could murder a cup of tea!
words.defineEn: used to show the possibility of something happening or being the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để hiển thị khả năng của một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: That kick of yours could have easily made mincemeat of my face.
Ciphers are easily broken by the new wonder machines.
Memorizing important dates in history came easily to him in school.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
Booksellers should easily be able to move this biography of Lincoln.
words.defineEn: very likely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: rất có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: Those events in Tokyo have an expected cost of $118 million.
and there's no expected reprieve.
The expected value of this is going to be this.
The expected cost varies from just six figures for a demonstrator, and then it goes into the several millions for a plant of the size we're currently building.
In the next video I'll introduce you to the idea of an expected value.
words.defineEn: considered to be probable or possible to happen
words.defineVi: được coi là có thể xảy ra hoặc có thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: ‌used to express the probability of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện xác suất của một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to add information or details to something in order to make it seem more credible or probable
words.defineVi: để thêm thông tin hoặc chi tiết vào một cái gì đó để làm cho nó có vẻ đáng tin cậy hơn hoặc có thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: used to point out the probability of something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra xác suất của một cái gì đó

examples: The film looks likely to offend many people.
This move is likely to raise alarm bells with the French government.
The proposals are likely to mean another hundred closures.
Capital spending this year is likely to hit $1,800 million.
"That's a likely story!"
words.defineEn: having a possibility of happening or being the case
words.defineVi: có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: The girls looked so pretty in their summer dresses.
The food looks good.
The garden looks nice.
Her father looked unhappy.
The house looks east.
words.defineEn: to be likely to occur or to appear to be the case
words.defineVi: có khả năng xảy ra hoặc dường như là trường hợp

examples: I might be getting the flu.
"Yeah, and pigs might fly."
Yeah, and pigs might fly.
You might as well bring sand to the beach!
You might as well just quit.
words.defineEn: used to express a possibility
words.defineVi: dùng để diễn đạt một khả năng

examples: The intense gaze from across the room, eyes on stalks, left no doubt about his attraction.
There will no doubt be a great hue and cry when the reorganisation is announced.
There is no doubt that knowledge is power, and those who seek to learn will always have an advantage in life.
The trees are aflame with color this week, letting there be no doubt we are really and truly in autumn.
No doubt plastics are useful.
words.defineEn: used to say that something is likely to happen or is true
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

words.defineEn: used to emphasize the fact that someone's expectations or wishes are very unlikely to be fulfilled
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nhấn mạnh thực tế là kỳ vọng hoặc mong muốn của ai đó rất khó có thể được thực hiện

words.defineEn: without any specific plans or assurance of success
words.defineVi: không có bất kỳ kế hoạch cụ thể hoặc đảm bảo thành công

examples: The company ought to do something about the poor service.
You ought to see a doctor about that cough.
Peter ought to be ashamed of himself.
He ought to resign, I think.
If you're passing blood you ought to see a doctor.
words.defineEn: used to talk about what one expects or likes to happen
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói về những gì một người mong đợi hoặc muốn xảy ra

examples: The manager keeps changing his outlook on the project, now really hopeful, now very pessimistic.
Although they had only just met, the two strangers found themselves talking for hours, realizing they were kindred spirits with a shared sense of humor and outlook on life.
They have different outlooks.
Your reaction to failure shapes your long-term outlook.
What's your outlook for that?
words.defineEn: someone or something's probable future; what is likely to occur
words.defineVi: ai đó hoặc một cái gì đó có thể xảy ra trong tương lai; những gì có khả năng xảy ra

examples: REM sleep is kinda paradoxical.
The paradoxical nature of this trait was personified for the ancient Greeks in the mythical figure of Pandora.
Let's just follow the paradoxical timeline through BEYOND its paradoxical conclusion.
Let's just follow the paradoxical timeline through BEYOND its paradoxical conclusion.
It’s the very act of struggling with these paradoxical puzzles which challenge our desire for resolution, and our understanding of understanding itself.
words.defineEn: (of a statement) containing two opposing facts or ideas that make it seem absurd
words.defineVi: (của một tuyên bố) chứa hai sự thật hoặc ý tưởng đối lập khiến nó có vẻ vô lý

examples: Perhaps it had something to do with their drink.
Perhaps we should consider the flip side of the coin : there should be no expenditure without representation.
I know there's a lot to discuss, but perhaps we should take a break for now.
The chances of Francis eventually becoming manager of England are perhaps higher.
Next week perhaps I’ll find myself wearing a different hat.
words.defineEn: used to express possibility or to show one's uncertainty about something
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện khả năng hoặc để thể hiện sự không chắc chắn của một người về điều gì đó

examples: We are considering various possibilities.
Support the possibility of keeping a lid on tax increases.
The morning is a time of new beginnings and possibilities.
Moving to London is certainly a possibility - I wouldn't dismiss it out of hand.
Don't worry about the possibility of getting a flat tire on your road trip, never trouble trouble till trouble troubles you.
words.defineEn: possibility refers to the state or condition of being able to happen or exist, or a potential likelihood of something happening or being true
words.defineVi: khả năng đề cập đến trạng thái hoặc điều kiện có thể xảy ra hoặc tồn tại, hoặc khả năng xảy ra hoặc là sự thật.

examples: It is possible that parents have lost sight of their children as a result of their own problems.
It is possible to go without food for a few days.
Sorry, it's not possible to lend you my car.
The CEO is meeting her opposite number at Fukuda Electronics to discuss a possible joint venture.
I think it's possible to find a balance, you know?
words.defineEn: able to exist, happen, or be done
words.defineVi: có thể tồn tại, xảy ra, hoặc được thực hiện

examples: This has their web FAI information on it presumably.
Presumably this would go somewhere else.
Presumably, it's costing your neighbor a fortune as well. -
So presumably, bigger Dimetrodons would need bigger sails.
And then presumably, there's also,
words.defineEn: used to say that the thing mentioned is based on an assumption
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng điều được đề cập là dựa trên một giả định

examples: Like, there is a presumption that we're all Americans together.
It's based on the presumption that there are about four million babies born each year.
There's a presumption of goodwill, that we can have a conversation.
This presumption means that in criminal cases, juries and judges have to act as though the accused is innocent until the prosecution convinces them otherwise.
Mounting an anti-colonial exhibition and publishing pamphlets to protest the racist and imperial presumptions of the 1931 colonial exhibition in Paris.
words.defineEn: a belief that something is true without any proof
words.defineVi: một niềm tin rằng một cái gì đó là sự thật mà không cần bất kỳ bằng chứng

examples: Everything is probabilistic.
Where it's bonded together like this, it's also sharing some electrons in a covalent bond, everything's probabilistic.
It happens because protons are small enough that the probabilistic element of quantum mechanics plays a big role.
While everyday objects like tennis balls or springs have simple and predictable motion, objects at quantum scales are probabilistic.
They behave based on quantum mechanical, 3-dimensional wave functions, probabilistic distributions of electrons in space.
words.defineEn: being solely based on an idea or theory one cannot be certain about
words.defineVi: chỉ dựa trên một ý tưởng hoặc lý thuyết, người ta không thể chắc chắn về

examples: A post, which in all probability, is fake and written solely for either earning a brownie point or being afraid of left out.
Which light-absorbing molecule in which cone a particular photon hits, comes down to probability.
These numbers are probabilities.
Probability that this is a dog: 93%!
The probability is less than our significance level.
words.defineEn: how possible or likely something is to happen
words.defineVi: làm thế nào có thể hoặc có khả năng một cái gì đó sẽ xảy ra

examples: Scientists have already found probable candidates, too.
[Narrator] Some of the death certificates list probable COVID-19 as the cause of death, but tests were in short supply.
And he says that it’s simply more probable that God designed the world, than that it came about through the pure chance of evolutionary processes.
Klare says that Rank One's technology was misused in this case, because a match is not probable cause for arrest.
Another one of the probable functions of capsaicin was to keep organisms like us away.
words.defineEn: with a high possibility to happen or be true but not certain
words.defineVi: với khả năng xảy ra cao hoặc có thật nhưng không chắc chắn

examples: The overwhelming majority of Irish-Americans probably persuaded the administration that the cake was not worth the candle.
Probably the only one who can see the forest for the trees.
He probably got them off the back of a truck.
We should probably invest in a good home security system.
I can probably reach him on his mobile.
words.defineEn: used for saying that something is likely to happen or be the case
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để nói rằng một cái gì đó có khả năng xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp

examples: Others blamed bad weather on witches, always a safe bet, or on natural phenomena like eclipses, earthquakes, comets, or sunspots.
Speaking with a tax professional and a financial planner about your situation will always be a safe bet when deciding which IRA to house your investments of choice.
I would almost look at it as a safe bet, you know, to hedge your risks.
That meant credit agencies could still point to historical data that indicated mortgage debt was a safe bet.
That might be, in its way, a very safe bet.
words.defineEn: ‌a thing that is extremely likely to be true or happen
words.defineVi: ‌một điều cực kỳ có khả năng là sự thật hoặc xảy ra

examples: That DJ's voice really sets my teeth on edge.
The surgeon set her broken arm.
The scheme sets a precedent for other companies.
International companies set the price of oil.
His time in the 25-meter freestyle set a national record.
words.defineEn: prepared for something or to do something; likely to do something
words.defineVi: chuẩn bị cho một cái gì đó hoặc để làm một cái gì đó; có khả năng làm một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: to have a likelihood of success or achieving a desired outcome
words.defineVi: để có một khả năng thành công hoặc đạt được một kết quả mong muốn

words.defineEn: (particularly of something bad) assumed to have happened or be the case without having any proof
words.defineVi: (đặc biệt của một cái gì đó tồi tệ) được cho là đã xảy ra hoặc là trường hợp mà không có bất kỳ bằng chứng nào

words.defineEn: extremely likely
words.defineVi: rất có khả năng

examples: The horse took the first fence well.
Generally, the article reads very well.
The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: used to indicate that there is a high chance for something to happen or be true
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để chỉ ra rằng có một cơ hội cao cho một cái gì đó xảy ra hoặc là sự thật

examples: Maybe this photograph will jog your memory.
His new world record will take some beating.
The center will serve the whole community.
The judge will have the last word on the divorce agreement.
A white blouse will show the blood.
words.defineEn: used to express what one deems true or probable
words.defineVi: được sử dụng để thể hiện những gì một người cho là đúng hoặc có thể xảy ra

words.defineEn: the probabilities or chances of something actually taking place
words.defineVi: xác suất hoặc cơ hội của một cái gì đó thực sự diễn ra
